1.text: Choose bananas based on their degree of ripeness.

2.text: Remove bananas from plastic produce bags as soon as you get them home.

3.text: Store green bananas at room temperature.

4.text: Leave yellow-green ripening bananas exposed to air at room temperature for a few days.

5.text: Hang the bananas on a banana tree.

6.text: Keep ripe bananas at room temperature if you will be eating them within a few days.

8.text: Pull the bananas apart from the bunch.

9.text: Store the ripe bananas with unripe fruit.

10.text: Wrap the stems of the bananas in plastic wrap.

11.text: Put the bananas in the produce drawer of your refrigerator after they are fully ripe.

12.text: Peel the bananas before freezing them.

13.text: Store bananas in the freezer for several months.

14.text: Make banana bread with overripe bananas.
